sen.j: 吉村酒造株式会社（よしむらしゅぞう）は京都市伏見区上板橋町に本社を置く清酒の生産・販売業をおこなう会社である
sen.e: Yoshimura Shuzo Co., Ltd. is a company engaged in production and sale of seishu (refined sake), with its principal office at Kami-itabashi cho, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.
Yoshimura Shuzo Co., Ltd. is a company engaged in production and sale of seishu (refined sake), with its principal office at Kami-itabashi cho, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.
Yoshimura Shuzo Co., Ltd. is a company engaged in production and sale of seishu (refined sake), with its principal office at Kami-itabashi cho, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 社是（松葉屋要綱）―「慎重敢為」「利真於勤」「自彊不息」―
sen.e: Business Creeds (principles of Matsubaya): "Shincho-kani (When you want to accomplish something, prepare for it carefully before launching it, but challenge it unflinchingly once you have launched)"; "Ri wa Tsutomuru ni oite Shin nari (Profits should be made through contribution to the society)"; and "Mizukara Tsutomete Yamazu (Keep training yourself and never blow off)

sen.j: 吉村家
sen.e: The Yoshimura Family
The Yoshimura Family
The Yoshimura Family

sen.j: 蔵元の吉村家は、江戸時代に伏見城廃城にたずさわり、明治時代まで伏見廻八箇村の掘内村』（現在の桃山御陵）で庄屋を務めていた吉村家勘兵衛家の分家。
sen.e: The Yoshimura family as the Kuramoto (sake brewer) is a branch family of the Kanbe family of the Yoshimura family who had once been engaged in desertion of Fushimi Castle during Edo era and served until Meiji era as shoya (a village headman) of Horiuchi-mura (Horiuchi-village), one of Fushimi-mawari Hachi-ka-son (eight villages around Fushimi), which is currently named as Momoyama-goryo.

The Yoshimura family as the Kuramoto (sake brewer) is a branch family of the Kanbe family of the Yoshimura family who had once deserted Fushimi Castle during the Edo era and served until Meiji era as shoya (a village headman) of Horiuchi-mura (Horiuchi-village), one of Fushimi-mawari Hachi-ka-son (eight villages around Fushimi), which is currently named as Momoyama-goryo.

The Yoshimura family as the Kuramoto (sake brewer) is a branch family of Kanbe YOSHIMURA's family who had once deserted Fushimi Castle during the Edo period and served until Meiji period as shoya (a village headman) of Horiuchi-mura (Horiuchi village), one of Fushimi-mawari Hachi-ka-son (eight villages around Fushimi), which is currently named as Momoyama-goryo.
sen.cmt: a branch family of the Kanbe family of the Yoshimura family→a branch family of Kanbe YOSHIMURA's family-削除era→periodに変更しました。

sen.j: 本家の「吉村勘兵衛家」や 同じく分家の「冥加屋吉村家」と区別するために「松葉屋吉村家」を名乗っている。
sen.e: This Yoshimura family calls itself Matsubaya-Yoshimura family to distinguish it from the head family, the Kanbe family of the Yoshimura family and also from another branch family called the Myogaya-Yoshimura family.

This Yoshimura family calls itself Matsubaya-Yoshimura family to distinguish it from the head family, the Kanbe family of the Yoshimura family and also from another branch family called the Myogaya-Yoshimura family.

This Yoshimura family calls itself 'Matsubaya-Yoshimura family' to distinguish it from the head family, the Kanbe family of the Yoshimura family and also from another branch family called the 'Myogaya-Yoshimura family.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ'を補足the Kanbe family of the Yoshimura family→the Kanbe YOSHIMURA family

sen.j: 和歌山県の酒造会社 吉村秀雄商店や、山口県の酒造会社 吉村酒造（福霞）、熊本県の瑞鷹酒造（吉村家）とは資本関係も血縁関係も無い。
sen.e: It has no capital ties nor blood relationship with Yoshimura Hideo Shoten, a sake brewery in Wakayama Prefecture, Yoshimura Shuzo (Fukukasumi.) another sake brewery in Yamaguchi Prefecture, and Zuiyo sake brewery (Yoshimura family) in Kumamoto Prefecture.

It has no capital ties nor blood relationship with Yoshimura Hideo Shoten, a sake brewery in Wakayama Prefecture, Yoshimura Shuzo (Fukukasumi.) another sake brewery in Yamaguchi Prefecture, and Zuiyo sake brewery (Yoshimura family) in Kumamoto Prefecture.

It has no capital ties nor blood relationship with Yoshimura Hideo Shoten, a sake brewery in Wakayama Prefecture, Yoshimura Shuzo (Fukukasumi.) another sake brewery in Yamaguchi Prefecture, and Zuiyo sake brewery (Yoshimura family) in Kumamoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 系譜
sen.e: Genealogy
sen.cmt: 追加翻訳部分です。ご確認願います。

sen.j: 源兵衛（初代）は、野菜商、源之助（2代）は水車精米業、源三郎（３代）は大日本帝国陸軍第16師団の御用商、陸運業を皮切りに酒造業に進出した。
sen.e: The first head of the family, Genbe, was a vegetable vendor; the second head, Gennosuke, was engaged in water-wheel rice milling; and the third head, Genzaburo，started off as a government contractor for the 16th Division of the Imperial Japanese Army, after which he became a carrier and then made his way into the sake brewing industry.
sen.cmt: 追加翻訳部分です。ご確認願います。

sen.j: 3代目吉村源三郎は、紀伊郡議会議員、伏見町議会議員、伏見市議会議員（憲政会・立憲民政党）を歴任した。
sen.e: The third head of this family, Genzaburo YOSHIMURA, was a person who had been successively appointed to become a member of congressions of Kii-gun, Fushimi Town and Fushimi City (as a member of political parties named Kenseikai and Rikken Minsei-to.)

The third head of this family, Genzaburo YOSHIMURA, was a person who had been successively appointed to become a member of the congress of Kii-gun, Fushimi Town and Fushimi City (as a member of political parties named Kenseikai and Rikken Minsei-to.)

Genzaburo YOSHIMURA was appointed a member of the Kii-gun Assembly, the Fushimi Town Assembly, and the Fushimi City Assembly (as a member of the Kenseikai and Rikken Minsei-to political parties) on successive occasions.
sen.cmt: 上の文を追加したため、最初の部分The third head of this family,を削除しました。ご確認願います。

sen.j: 4代目吉村源太郎は、戦時企業整備令によって廃業・休業した全国の酒造会社の清酒製造免許復活許可を求める全国組織「酒造業 復活期成同盟」の代表を務め、1947年連合国軍最高司令官総司令部（GHQ）に直訴。
sen.e: The fourth head, Gentaro YOSHIMURA, had a career as the representative of the Shuzogyo Fukkatsu Kisei-domei (an association formed to carry out reactivation of the sake brewing industry,) which is a nationwide organization to submit requests for permission to restore the license to brew seishu by the sake breweries across the country who had been compelled to close or suspend their business by Senji Kigyo Seibi Rei (the acts for industrial readjustment in wartime,) and made a direct plea to the General Headquarters of the Allied Forces (GHQ) in 1947.

The fourth head, Gentaro YOSHIMURA, had a career as the representative of the Shuzogyo Fukkatsu Kisei-domei (an association formed to carry out reactivation of the sake brewing industry,) which is a nationwide organization to submit requests for permission to restore the license to brew seishu by the sake breweries across the country who had been compelled to close or suspend their business by Senji Kigyo Seibi Rei (the acts for industrial readjustment in wartime) and he made a direct plea to the General Headquarters of the Allied Forces (GHQ) in 1947.

The fourth head, Gentaro YOSHIMURA, had a career as the representative of the Shuzogyo Fukkatsu Kisei-domei (an association formed to carry out reactivation of the sake brewing industry,) which is a nationwide organization to submit requests for permission to restore the license to brew seishu by the sake breweries across the country who had been compelled to close or suspend their business by Senji Kigyo Seibi Rei (the acts for industrial readjustment in wartime) and he made a direct plea to the General Headquarters of the Allied Forces (GHQ) in 1947.

sen.j: 直訴の翌日、GHQ民生局によって清酒製造免許の条件付復活許可が日本政府に通達された。
sen.e: On the following day of the plea to GHQ, the General Section of GHQ transmitted its authorization for conditional restoration of the license to brew seishu..
On the following day of the plea to GHQ, the General Section of GHQ transmitted its authorization for conditional restoration of the license to brew seishu..
On the following day of the plea to GHQ, the General Section of GHQ transmitted its authorization for conditional restoration of the license to brew seishu.

sen.j: 5代目吉村源一郎は、日本酒業界では全国に先駆けて全製品のサリチル酸無添加化を実現。
sen.e: The fifth head of the family, Genishiro YOSHIMURA, successfully realized brewing of all seish free of salicylic acid as a forerunner in the sake brewing business.
The fifth head of the family, Genishiro YOSHIMURA, successfully realized brewing of seishu free of salicylic acid as a forerunner in the sake brewing business.
The fifth head of the family, Genishiro YOSHIMURA, successfully realized brewing of seishu free of salicylic acid as a forerunner in the sake brewing business.

sen.j: 清酒中のカルバミン酸エチル削減に効果的とされる急速冷却装置を開発した。
sen.e: He has developed a rapid cooling device regarded to be effective to decrease ethyl carbamate contained in seishu.
He has developed a rapid cooling device regarded to be effective to decrease ethyl carbamate contained in seishu.
He has developed a rapid cooling device regarded to be effective to decrease ethyl carbamate contained in seishu.

sen.j: また、伏見酒造組合 原料委員長として京都産・酒米「祝」復活の中心的な役割を担った。
sen.e: He has also played a central role as a chairman of the basic ingredient committee of the Fushimi Sake Maker's Association to revive the brand of "Iwai" as the suitable rice produced in Kyoto for sake brewery.

He has also played a central role as chairman of the basic ingredient committee of the Fushimi Sake Maker's Association to revive the brand of "Iwai" as the suitable rice produced in Kyoto for brewering sake.

He has also played a central role as chairman of the basic ingredient committee of the Fushimi Sake Maker's Association to revive the brand of 'Iwai' as the suitable rice produced in Kyoto for brewering sake.

sen.j: 3代目～5代目までは、全国でも珍しい『自社製品の全量自家精米』を貫いた事でも有名。
sen.e: The third to fifth heads of the family are well known that they have coherently used home-polished rice for all products.
The third to fifth heads of the family are well known for having consistently used home-polished rice for all products.
The third to fifth heads of the family are well known for having consistently used "home-polished rice for all products."

sen.j: 安土桃山時代～江戸時代
sen.e: From Azuchi-Momoyama Era to Edo Era
From Azuchi-Momoyama Era to Edo Era

sen.cmt: Azuchi-Momoyama era→the Azuchi-Momoyama periodに変更しました。Edo era→the Edo periodに変更しました。

sen.j: 1607年 －松平定勝の家臣、吉村勘兵衛(1世)が、遠江国掛川（現在の掛川市）より伏見に移住。
sen.e: In 1607, Kanbe YOSHIMURA (the 1st.), a retainer of Sadakatsu MATSUDAIRA, migrated to Fushimi from Kakegawa of Toto-umi-no-kuni (current Kakegawa City.)
In 1607, Kanbe YOSHIMURA (the 1st.), a retainer of Sadakatsu MATSUDAIRA, migrated to Fushimi from Kakegawa of Toto-umi-no-kuni (currently Kakegawa City.)
1607: Kanbe YOSHIMURA (the 1st.), a retainer of Sadakatsu MATSUDAIRA, migrated to Fushimi from Kakegawa of Totoumi Province (currently Kakegawa City.)
sen.cmt: Toto-umi-no-kuni→Totomi ProvinceTotomi Province→Totoumi Provinceに変更しました。In 1607,→1607:に変更しました。

sen.j: 1623年 －伏見城の廃城跡に「掘内村」を創設。
sen.e: In 1623, he founded "Horiuchi-mura village" on empty lots of the old deserted Fushimi Castle.
In 1623, he founded "Horiuchi-mura village" on the empty lots of the old deserted Fushimi Castle.
1623: He founded 'Horiuchi village' on the empty lots of the old deserted Fushimi Castle.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'に-mura削除In 1623, he→1623: Heに変更しました。

sen.j: 伏見奉行支配の庄屋を務める
sen.e: He served as shoya (a village headman) under the control of Fushimi bugyo (a magistrate of Fushimi area.)
He served as shoya (a village headman) under the control of Fushimi bugyo (a magistrate of Fushimi area.)
He served as shoya (a village headman) under the control of Fushimi bugyo (a magistrate of Fushimi area.)

sen.j: 1850年 －総本家より分家し、掘内村・江戸町にて屋号「松葉屋」で京野菜の販売を始める。
sen.e: In 1850, he separated his family from so-honke (the primary head family) and established a branch family to launch sales of kyo-yasai (typical Kyoto vegetables) under the trade name of "Matsubaya" at Edo-cho of Horiuchi-mura village.

In 1850, he separated his family from so-honke (the primary head family) and established a branch family to launch sales of kyo-yasai (typical Kyoto vegetables) under the trade name of "Matsubaya" at Edo-cho of Horiuchi-mura village.

1850: He separated his family from so-honke (the primary head family) and established a branch family to launch sales of kyo-yasai (typical Kyoto vegetables) under the trade name of 'Matsubaya' at Horiuchi village of Edo-cho.

sen.e: In 1896, after the demise of Emperor Meiji, he dedicated/sold out his domain to the Imperial Household Ministry.
In 1896, after the demise of Emperor Meiji, he dedicated/sold out his domain to the Imperial Household Ministry.

sen.j: 伏見区津知橋に本拠地を移転。

He moved his home place of business to Tsuchibashi-cho, Fushimi Ward.

sen.j: 1896年～ 水車精米業、運送業など主に大日本帝国陸軍第16師団司令部の御用商として発展。
sen.e: From 1896, he developed his business mainly as a purveyor to the headquarters of Dai Juroku Shidan (the 16th division) of the Imperial Japanese Army, including rice milling with water wheels, transportation and others.

From 1896, he developed his business mainly as a purveyor to the headquarters of Dai Juroku Shidan (the 16th division) of the Imperial Japanese Army, including rice milling with water wheels, transportation and others.

sen.j: 伏見区御駕籠町の酒蔵を借り、清酒「誉輝」「四季の誉」の醸造を開始。
sen.e: He rented shuzo (sake warehouses) at Okago-cho, Fushimi Ward, to start brewing seishu (refined sake) under the brand names of "Yoki (literally, honor with brilliance)" and "Shiki-no-homare (literally, honor of four seasons.)"

He rented shuzo (sake warehouses) at Okago-cho, Fushimi Ward, to start brewing seishu (refined sake) under the brand names of "Yoki (literally, honor with brilliance)" and "Shiki-no-homare (literally, honor of four seasons.)"

He rented shuzo (sake warehouses) at Okago-cho, Fushimi Ward, to start brewing seishu (refined sake) under the brand names of 'Yoki (literally, honor with brilliance)' and 'Shiki-no-homare (literally, honor of four seasons).'

sen.j: 1920年 – 伏見区上板橋町に酒蔵（本社蔵）を建設。
sen.e: In 1920, he constructed his company's own shuzo (sake warehouses) at Kami-itabashi-cho, Fushimi Ward.
In 1920, he constructed his company's own shuzo (sake warehouses) at Kami-itabashi-cho, Fushimi Ward.

The fourth head, Gentaro YOSHIMURA, assumed the post of the company's representative.
The fourth head, Gentaro YOSHIMURA, assumed the post of the company's representative.

sen.j: 1944年 －第二次世界大戦の戦時国策による「戦時企業整備令」に基づき休業。
sen.e: In 1944, the company suspended its operation due to the act for industrial adjustment in wartime issued by the government under its national policy in wartime of the World War II.
In 1944, the company suspended its operation due to the act for industrial adjustment in wartime issued by the government under its national policy in wartime during World War II.
1944: The company suspended its operation due to the act for industrial adjustment in wartime issued by the government under its national policy in wartime during World War II.

sen.j: 1945年 －酒蔵が大日本帝国陸軍の食料倉庫として活用される。
sen.e: In 1945, the company's shuzo (sake warehouses) were converted to warehouses for food of the Imperial Japanese Army.
In 1945, the company's shuzo (sake warehouses) were converted to warehouses for food of the Imperial Japanese Army.
1945: The company's shuzo (sake warehouses) were converted to warehouses for food of the Imperial Japanese Army.
sen.cmt: In 1945, the→1945: Theに変更しました。

sen.j: 1947年 －連合国軍最高司令官総司令部への直訴によって復活。
sen.e: In 1947, the company restored its operation after making a direct plea to the General Headquarters of the Allied Forces.
In 1947, the company restored its operation after making a direct plea to the General Headquarters of the Allied Forces.
1947: The company restored its operation after making a direct plea to the General Headquarters of the Allied Forces.
sen.cmt: In 1947, the→1947: Theに変更しました。

sen.j: 代表銘柄を「百萬弗」に改める。
sen.e: Its representative brand was renamed to "Hyakuman-doru (literally, one million dollars.)"
Its representative brand was renamed "Hyakuman-doru (literally, one million dollars.)"
Its representative brand was renamed 'Hyakuman-doru (literally, one million dollars).'

sen.j: 1950年 －中泉㈱（現：㈱リョーショクリカー）との特約契約により「百萬弗」の主要販売先を群馬県に定める。
sen.e: In 1950, under the special agreement with Nakaizumi Co., Ltd. (currently, Ryoshoku Liquor Limited,) the "Hyakuman-doru" was decided to be marketed mainly in Gunma Prefecture.
In 1950, under the special agreement with Nakaizumi Co., Ltd. (currently, Ryoshoku Liquor Limited,) it was decided to market "Hyakuman-doru" mainly in Gunma Prefecture.
1950: Under the special agreement with Nakaizumi Co., Ltd. (currently, Ryoshoku Liquor Limited,) it was decided to market 'Hyakuman-doru' mainly in Gunma Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'にIn 1950, under→1950: Underに変更しました。

sen.j: 昭和後期
sen.e: During Late Showa Era
During Late Showa Era
During Late Showa Era

sen.j: 1956年 – 吉村酒造株式会社に改組
sen.e: In 1956, the company was reorganized to Yoshimura Shuzo Co., Ltd.
In 1956, the company was reorganized to Yoshimura Shuzo Co., Ltd.
1956: The company was reorganized to Yoshimura Shuzo Co., Ltd.
sen.cmt: In 1956, the→1956: Theに変更しました。

sen.j: 1967年 – 特級酒、１級酒の防腐剤（サリチル酸）無添加」を実施。
sen.e: In 1967, it began production of highest class and first class sake free from preservatives (salicylic acid).
In 1967, it began production of highest class, first class sake free from preservatives (salicylic acid).
1967: It began production of highest class, first class sake free from preservatives (salicylic acid).
sen.cmt: In 1967, it→1967: Itに変更しました。

sen.j: 1968年 – ２級酒のサリチル酸無添加を実施。
sen.e: In 1968, it started brewing second class sake also free from salicylic acid.
In 1968, it started brewing second class sake also free from salicylic acid.
1968: It started brewing second class sake also free from salicylic acid.
sen.cmt: In 1968, it→1968: Itに変更しました。

sen.j: （全国に先駆けて全製品のサリチル酸無添加を完了）
sen.e: (As a vanguard of the industry, it has implemented making complete range of products free from salicylic acid).
(As a vanguard of the industry, it has implemented making a complete range of products free from salicylic acid).
(As a vanguard of the industry, it has implemented making a complete range of products free from salicylic acid.)

sen.j: 1969年 – 清酒のサリチル酸問題が勃発。
sen.e: In 1969, salicylic acid added to seishu (refined sake) became an issue.
In 1969, salicylic acid added to seishu (refined sake) became an issue.
1969: Salicylic acid added to seishu (refined sake) became an issue.
sen.cmt: In 1969, salicylic→1969: Salicylicに変更しました。

sen.j: 一躍脚光をあびる。
sen.e: The company's technology to avoid salicylic acid has attracted much attention.
The company's technology used to avoid salicylic acid has attracted much attention.
The company's technology used to avoid salicylic acid has attracted much attention.

sen.j: 1971年 – 伏見第二工場（治部蔵）を建設。
sen.e: In 1971, its second plant in Fushimi (a brewery named Jibu-gura) was constructed.
In 1971, its second plant in Fushimi (a brewery named Jibu-gura) was constructed.
1971: Its second plant in Fushimi (a brewery named Jibu-gura) was constructed.
sen.cmt: In 1971, its→1971: Itsに変更しました。

sen.j: 1972年 – 「百萬弗」の販売量が１万石を突破。
sen.e: In 1972, sales of "Hyakuman-doru" topped ten thousands koku.
In 1972, sales of "Hyakuman-doru" topped ten thousands koku.
1972: Sales of 'Hyakuman-doru' topped ten thousands koku.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'にIn 1972, sales→1972: Salesに変更しました。

sen.j: 1985年 – 清酒「太白」の販売を開始。
sen.e: In 1985, it started sales of seishu (refined sake) under the brand name "Taihaku (ancient Chinese name of planet Venus)"
In 1985, it started sales of seishu (refined sake) under the brand name "Taihaku (ancient Chinese name for the planet Venus)"
1985: It started sales of seishu (refined sake) under the brand name 'Taihaku (ancient Chinese name for the planet Venus).'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'にピリオド補足In 1985, it→1985: Itに変更しました。

sen.j: 1984年 - 大学の研究機関と共同で、清酒中のカルバミン酸エチルに関する研究及び削減方法の研究を開始。
sen.e: In 1984, the company initiated a research on ethyl carbamate and how to reduce it contained in seishu (refined sake) in cooperation with a research body of a university.
In 1984, the company initiated research on ethyl carbamate and how to reduce it in seishu (refined sake) in cooperation with a research body of a university.
1984: The company initiated research on ethyl carbamate and how to reduce it in seishu (refined sake) in cooperation with a research body of a university.
sen.cmt: In 1984, the→1984: Theに変更しました。

sen.j: 清酒中からの抽出実験に成功。
sen.e: Ethyl carbamate was successfully extracted from seishu.
Ethyl carbamate was successfully extracted from seishu.
Ethyl carbamate was successfully extracted from seishu.

sen.j: 1986年 - 清酒製造過程でのカルバミン酸エチル削減法として急速冷却方式の実験施設完成。
sen.e: In 1986, an experimental facility of the rapid quenching system as a method to reduce ethyl carbamate in the process of seishu production was completed.
In 1986, an experimental facility for a rapid quenching system as a method to reduce ethyl carbamate in the process of seishu production was completed.
1986: An experimental facility for a rapid quenching system as a method to reduce ethyl carbamate in the process of seishu production was completed.
sen.cmt: In 1986, an→1986: Anに変更しました。

sen.j: 製造現場で実証を開始。
sen.e: The company started demonstration of the system at production site.
The company started demonstrating the system at the production site.
The company started demonstrating the system at the production site.

sen.j: 1989年 – 4代目・吉村源太郎が会長に就任。
sen.e: In 1989, the fourth head of the family, Gentaro YOSHIMURA, ascended to a chairman of the company.
In 1989, the fourth head of the family, Gentaro YOSHIMURA, ascended to chairman of the company.
1989: The fourth head of the family, Gentaro YOSHIMURA, ascended to chairman of the company.

sen.j: 5代目・吉村源一郎が社長に就任。
sen.e: The fifth head, Genichiro YOSHIMURA, took the presidential position of the company.
The fifth head, Genichiro YOSHIMURA, took the position of president of the company.
The fifth head, Genichiro YOSHIMURA, took the position of president of the company.

sen.j: 平成～
sen.e: During Heisei era after 1989

sen.e: In 1997, the fourth head of the family, Gentaro YOSHIMURA, died.

sen.j: 2000年 – 兵庫県浜坂町に酒蔵（但馬蔵）を建設し、本拠地を移転。
sen.e: In 2000, the company constructed new shuzo (sake warehouses) called Tajima-gura at Hamasaka-cho, Hyogo Prefecture, and moved its home place of business thereto.

sen.j: 清酒「風鶴」の販売を開始。
sen.e: A new brand, Fuzuru (literally, a crane in the wind), made a debut..

sen.j: 6代目 吉村正裕が社長に就任。

the sixth head, Masahiro YOSHIMURA, became the president of the company.

sen.j: 経営合理化３ヵ年計画「アクションプラン-21」を発表。
sen.e: He announced the company's three-year plan for the management rationalization, called "Action Plan 21."
He announced the company's three-year plan for management rationalization, called "Action Plan 21."

sen.j: OEMを推進。

sen.j: 2004年 – 但馬蔵の隣地に新但馬蔵を建設し、集約移動。
sen.e: In 2004, the company constructed Shin Tajima-gura (new Tajima sake warehouses) in the adjacent area of the Tajima-gura, and shifted all of the current facilities to the newly constructed area.

He announced the company's three-year plan for management transformation.

sen.j: ファブレス化を推進。
sen.e: He promoted conversion of the company management to the fabless management.
He promoted conversion of the company management to the fabless management.
He promoted conversion of the company management to the management without sake warehouses.

sen.j: 2006年 - 清酒「百萬弗」の製造・販売に関して、キンシ正宗（京都市）と業務提携を締結。

sen.j: 被災地支援
sen.e: Assistance to Affected Areas
Assistance to Affected Areas

sen.j: 阪神・淡路大震災の被災地に地下水を積んだタンクローリーを派遣するとともに、被災した灘の酒造メーカーの瓶詰を受託した。
sen.e: The company dispatched convoys of tank trucks to carry ground water to the area affected by the Great Hanshin-Awaji Earthquake, as well accepted bottling of sake on trust of affected sake brewers in Nada area.

The company dispatched convoys of tank trucks to carry ground water to the area affected by the Great Hanshin-Awaji Earthquake, as well accepting bottling of sake on trust of affected sake brewers in the Nada area.

sen.j: ※1996年の大阪国税局新酒鑑評会は阪神・淡路大震災のため中止し、1997年を最後に終了したため、実質は6回連続金賞受賞した事になる。
sen.e: *In 1996, activity of the Osaka Regional Taxation Bureau's Research Institute of Brewing was suspended due to the Great Hanshin-Awaji Earthquake, and was resumed in 1997 but as the last event to be discontinued from the next year, so that the company is regarded as have actually been awarded the "gold prizes" of the Institute for the sixth time in a row.

*In 1996, activity of the Osaka Regional Taxation Bureau's Research Institute of Brewing was suspended due to the Great Hanshin-Awaji Earthquake, and was resumed in 1997 but as the last event to be discontinued from the next year, so that the company is regarded as have actually been awarded the "gold prizes" of the Institute for the sixth time in a row.

* In 1996, activity of the Osaka Regional Taxation Bureau's Research Institute of Brewing was suspended due to the Great Hanshin-Awaji Earthquake, and was resumed in 1997 but as the last event to be discontinued from the next year, so that the company is regarded as have in fact been awarded the 'gold prize' of the Institute for the sixth time in a row.
sen.cmt: ※→*スペース補足原文の「」に合わせ"を'にactually →in factに変更しました。

sen.j: ※2002年より「吉村酒造は今後、全ての品評会に出品しない」と表明。
sen.e: *The company, Yoshimura Shuzo, declared that it will not exhibit any of its products at any fair from 2002.
*The company, Yoshimura Shuzo, declared that it will not exhibit any of its products at any fair from 2002.
* The company, Yoshimura Shuzo, declared that 'it will not exhibit any of its products' at any fair from 2002.
sen.cmt: ※→*スペース補足原文の「」に合わせ'を補足

sen.j: ＣＭ
sen.e: CM (commercial messages)
CM (commercial messages)
CM (commercial messages)

sen.j: 1970年代に群馬県のローカルTV番組に舞妓をモデルにした「伏見の清酒 百萬弗」のCMを放映していた。
sen.e: In 1970s, advertisements of "Hyakuman-doru, seishu of Fushimi" had been aired on local TV programs in Gunma Prefecture, using images of maiko (apprentice geisha.)
In 1970s, advertisements of "Hyakuman-doru, seishu of Fushimi" had been aired on local TV programs in Gunma Prefecture, using images of maiko (apprentice geisha.)
In 1970s, advertisements of 'Hyakuman-doru, seishu of Fushimi' had been aired on local TV programs in Gunma Prefecture, using images of maiko (apprentice geisha.)

sen.j: 舞妓が販促キャンペーンのために 高崎に到着すると、「舞妓を見物するために大渋滞がおこった」という話は、今でも地域の人々の語り草になっている。
sen.e: It is still a well known story among the local people that, when a model of maiko arrived at Takasaki for sales campaign of sake, so many people gathered to watch her that nearby roads were massively clogged up.

It is still a well known story among the local people that, when a model of maiko arrived at Takasaki for sales campaign of sake, so many people gathered to watch her that nearby roads were massively clogged up.

It is still a well known story among the local people that, when a model of maiko arrived at Takasaki for sales campaign of sake, so many people gathered to watch her that nearby roads were massively clogged up.

sen.j: その他
sen.e: Others
Others
Others

sen.j: 1970年代～1980年代まで群馬県の国鉄前橋駅前や、高崎市のビルの屋上に横長のネオンサインを設置していた（高崎のネオンサインは1990年代まで上越新幹線の車窓から見ることができた）。
sen.e: From 1970s upto 1980s, horizontally long rectangular neon-light advertisements were installed in front of Maebashi station of Japan National Railways in Gunma Prefecture and on the roof of a building in Takasaki City, the latter of which could be seen from a train window of Joetsu Shinkansen until 1990s.

From 1970s upto 1980s, horizontally long rectangular neon-light advertisements were installed in front of Maebashi station of Japan National Railways in Gunma Prefecture and on the roof of a building in Takasaki City, the latter of which could be seen from a train window of Joetsu Shinkansen until 1990s.
